recentPerformance.last3Games: 27+ points in last 2 (28 vs MEM, 27 vs DAL)

keyFactors.title: Hot Scoring Streak
keyFactors.description: Entered averaging 18.6 PPG with 27+ points in previous two games, both shooting over 50% FG. Had cleared 16.5 in four straight games.

keyFactors.title: Elevated Role
keyFactors.description: Operating as hybrid point guard following Fred VanVleet's season-ending ACL injury. Primary ball-handler during 5-game winning streak.

keyFactors.title: San Antonio #2 Defense
keyFactors.description: Spurs ranked 2nd in defensive rating (109.6), but Thompson's athleticism suggested he could navigate.

keyFactors.title: Plus Odds Value
keyFactors.description: At +105, getting favorable odds despite Thompson's recent explosion.

quarterBreakdown.description: Struggled to find rhythm against Spurs' defense. Houston trailed by 13 in Q2, fell behind early. 50-50 at halftime.
San Antonio executed 22-4 run to seize control. Thompson became tertiary option as Durant (24 pts, 18 FGA) and Sengun (25 pts, 22 FGA) dominated touches.
Despite playing 39 minutes, shot volume disappeared. Only 12 total FGA (vs 26 previous game). Efficiency cratered to career-worst 33.3% FG.

gameResults.whenMissed: Never threatened the line - dramatic shot volume collapse from 26 FGA to just 12 attempts
gameResults.gamePace: Spurs' deliberate half-court style (24th in pace) limited Thompson's primary strength: transition scoring
gameResults.foulTrouble: No foul trouble - played 39 minutes freely but touches evaporated

whatWentWrong.title: Catastrophic Shot Volume Collapse
whatWentWrong.description: 44% reduction in field goal attempts - from 26 FGA vs Memphis to only 12 vs San Antonio. Even with normal 45-47% efficiency, needed 15+ attempts to clear 16.5.

whatWentWrong.title: Efficiency Regression
whatWentWrong.description: Career-worst 33.3% FG (vs 50%+ in previous games). Combination of fewer shots AND poor conversion doomed the prop.

whatWentWrong.title: Game Script Disaster
whatWentWrong.description: Loss environment shifted offensive hierarchy. Durant and Sengun dominated touches, fragmenting scoring opportunities. Reed Sheppard (16 pts) and Josh Okogie (12 pts) also absorbed shots.

whatWentWrong.title: San Antonio's Defensive Execution
whatWentWrong.description: #2 defense executed perfectly, slowing pace dramatically and limiting fast-break opportunities Thompson thrives in.

statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Bottom 20th percentile of season - worst scoring performance

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No - this was predictable game script issue, not variance. Shot volume collapse (26→12 FGA) was the killer, not bad luck.

closingLineValue.verdict: Neutral CLV. Pre-game reasoning was sound but unpredictable volume collapse proved fatal. Can't predict 44% FGA reduction.

keyTakeaways: Shot volume is king - no amount of efficiency overcomes 44% reduction in attempts (26→12)
Elite defenses (#2 ranked) combined with slow pace (24th) dangerous for volume-dependent scorers
Loss environment risk materialized - teammates (Durant, Sengun) dominated touches in catch-up mode
Recent hot streak (27-28 points) created recency bias - regression was due
Even sound analysis loses to unpredictable game script shifts
verdict: Sound pre-game analysis defeated by unpredictable shot volume collapse and game flow. Textbook bad beat - right process, wrong outcome.
